DOC.brief_title: Intravesical BCG Administration to Patients With Invasive Bladder Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with muscle invasive (≥T1) bladder cancer will be given 3-6 treatments (based on treatment response) intravesical TICE® BCG. BCG is an attenuated, live culture preparation of the Bacillus of Calmette and Guerin (BCG) strain of Mycobacterium bovis. After completion of BCG treatments the patient will undergo a cystectomy. A portion of bladder tumor tissue and lymph nodes will be collected for research purposes during the cystectomy.
DOC.criteria: 1. Have suspected or known invasive (≥T1) bladder cancer 2. Be able to give informed consent 3. Be age 18 or older 4. Not be in an immunosuppressed state (e.g. HIV+, use of chronic steroids >1 month) 1. Have noninvasive (<T1) bladder cancer 2. Unable to give informed consent 3. < 18 or older 4. Is in an immunosuppressed state (e.g. HIV+, use of chronic steroids >1 month)
